item.title: US to permanently pause migration from 'Third World Countries'
item.description: US President Donald Trump said on Thursday that his administration will work to "permanently pause" migration from all "Third World Countries" to allow the US system to fully recover. Trump did not identify any countries by name or explain what he meant by third-world countries or "permanently pau

item.title: Youth fatally stabbed amid ‘teen gang feud’ in Khulna
item.description: A young man has been stabbed to death during a clash between rival youth gangs in Khulna. The victim, identified as 21-year-old Ishan, was attacked on Thursday evening near the Khalishpur Fair Clinic intersection, according to Khalishpur Police Station chief Mir Atahar Ali. He died on the way to

item.title: Police arrest construction firm bosses over Hong Kong fire
item.description: Hong Kong police arrested the bosses of a construction company on suspicion of manslaughter on Thursday over the city's worst fire in nearly 80 years, which killed at least 83 people with scores more listed as missing. By the early hours of Friday, firefighters had mostly contained the blaze ragin

item.title: BNP condemns alleged Jamaat attack on electioneering in Pabna
item.description: Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) has strongly condemned a planned attack by armed Jamaat-e-Islami activists on its leaders, activists, and civilians during an election campaign in Pabna’s Ishwardi on Thursday afternoon. In a statement signed by BNP Senior Joint Secretary General Ruhul Kabi

item.title: Israeli forces kill two Palestinians in West Bank who appeared to be surrendering
item.description: Israeli security forces shot two Palestinian men on Thursday who appeared to be surrendering and unarmed during a raid in the Israeli-occupied West Bank, Palestine TV news footage showed. In the footage, the men are seen exiting a building surrounded by armed Israeli forces in the northern West Ba

item.title: Chinese investors can help transform Bangladesh into manufacturing hub: Prof Yunus
item.description: Chief Adviser Prof Muhammad Yunus has welcomed China’s interest in Bangladesh’s manufacturing sectors, noting that investors from the world’s second-largest economy could help transform Bangladesh into a manufacturing hub producing goods for export to developed nations, including

item.title: Man stabbed to death in ‘late-night mugging’ in Ctg
item.description: A man has been killed during a 'late-night mugging' in Chattogram. The incident occurred opposite the Chattogram District Council building in the port city’s Kotwali Thana on Thursday night. The victim has been identified as 30-year-old Md Ismail. He hailed from Lakshmipur, but lived in the

item.title: Trump says he may cut income tax 'completely' because of tariff income
item.description: US President Donald Trump said on Thursday his administration may slash income tax completely over the next couple of years because of government revenue generated from tariffs. "Over the next couple of years, I think we'll substantially be cutting and maybe cutting out completely, but we'll be cu

item.title: KUET student suspended for stabbing fellow student
item.description: Khulna University of Engineering and Technology (KUET) authorities have suspended a student for stabbing a fellow student over a dispute regarding street painting and stall locations for the first-year admission test. The accused, Kazi Sadiq Mahmud, is a student of the Civil Engineering Department

item.title: 39 more Bangladeshis deported from US
item.description: The United States has repatriated another group of Bangladeshi nationals, with 39 people arriving in Dhaka early Friday. The returnees landed at Hazrat Shahjalal International Airport (HSIA) around 5:30 am on a special US military flight. Airport authorities facilitated their arrival, while BRAC

item.title: Grandmother, granddaughter killed in Chandpur road crash
item.description: A grandmother and her six-year-old granddaughter were killed when a speeding passenger bus crashed into them on the Chandpur–Cumilla regional road in Hajiganj upazila of Chandpur district on Thursday night. The deceased were identified as Nazma Begum, and granddaughter Marzia Begum, resident

item.title: WFP provides emergency food aid fire-hit families in Korail slum
item.description: The United Nations World Food Programme (WFP) on Friday provided emergency food assistance to families affected by the devastating fire that swept through the Karail slum on Tuesday.
